alert.note: Alert for Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 12:12PM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Iowa and southeast Minnesota, including the following counties, in north central Iowa, Mitchell. In southeast Minnesota, Mower. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1212 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stacyville, McIntire, Meyer, Bailey, County Roads T 54 And A 31, Little Cedar, Johnsburg and Highway 218 And County T 40. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
